text:
The thumb is one of the five fingers on the human hand. Thumbs are different from the other four fingers because they are in a different direction, have only two bones (the others have three) and are shorter. Thumbs help us to pick things up. This is called having "opposable thumbs". All primate<nowiki/>s have thumbs but humans have fully opposable thumbs.
Thumbs have an artery in them. Arteries have a pulse. This is why we should not take other peoples' pulses with our thumbs.
